frame.name: Killing
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Killer">John</fex> <t>drowned</t> <fex name="Victim">Martha</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Killer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.</def-root >

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition: <def-root>The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cause">The rockslide</fex> <t>killed</t> nearly half of the climbers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of affairs that the <fen>Killer</fen> is trying to bring about by killing.
<ex>It's simple: he <t>killed</t> her <fex name="Purp">to get the inheritance</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The method or action that the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> performs resulting in the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>The flood <t>exterminated</t> the rats <fex name="Means">by cutting off access to food</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The preexisting state of affairs that the <fen>Killer</fen> is responding to.
<ex>She <t>drowned</t> him <fex name="Explanation">for lying</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the death took place.
<ex>Apparently there were two <t>murders</t> <fex name="Place">in Atherton</fex> in one week.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The point or period of time within which the <fen>Victim</fen> is killed.
<ex>There is no evidence that the royal family was <t>killed</t> <fex name="Time">during the destruction</fex> at this site.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Victim</fen> during the killing. </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Victim</fen> that results from being killed. (Normally this is somewhat redundant.)
<ex>Two men ... <t>smothered</t> her <fex name="Result">to death</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The device used by the <fen>Killer</fen> to bring about the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex>It's difficult to <t>suicide</t> <fex name="Instr">with only a pocketknife</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Killer</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). <ex><t>Kill</t> them <fex name="Manner">quietly</fex>.</ex> <ex>A true professional , he <t>beheaded</t> his victims <fex name="Man">with unhurried expertise</fex>, a credit to his calling.</ex> <ex>A gunman <t>slaughtered</t> six people <fex name="Man">in cold blood</fex> because he had been evicted.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> appears with adjectives to describe the killing potential of an object or with nouns to describe how widespread the killing is. <ex>The Nazis engaged in <fex name="Degree">mass</fex> <t>genocide</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>This extra-thematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: onthoofden.v
lexUnit.definition: het hoofd van de genoemde of de kop van het genoemde eraf slaan (ook figuurlijk)

lexUnit.name: vermoorden.v
lexUnit.definition: gewelddadig van het leven beroven (ook figuurlijk)

lexUnit.name: euthanasie.n
lexUnit.definition: (actief of passief) van patiënten met ondraaglijk en uitzichtloos lijden

lexUnit.name: lynchen.v
lexUnit.definition: de genoemde voor straf ter dood brengen zonder het vonnis van een rechter af te wachten

lexUnit.name: slachten.v
lexUnit.definition: doden van dieren, met name om het vlees
